docs.snippet: Mrs. Frederick W. Drury and Miss Frances Sands Drury of 18 East Sixtieth Street have gone to Great Barrington, Mass., for the remainder of the Summer.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Frederick W. Drury and Miss Frances Sands Drury of 18 East Sixtieth Street have gone to Great Barrington, Mass., for the remainder of the Summer.

docs.snippet: Arnaldo Estrella, Rio de Janiero pianist, has won the first Columbia Concerts Award for young Brazilian pianists, it was announced yesterday. His prize will consist of a debut as soloist with the New York Philharmonic-Symphony Orchestra in February,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Arnaldo Estrella, Rio de Janiero pianist, has won the first Columbia Concerts Award for young Brazilian pianists, it was announced yesterday. His prize will consist of a debut as soloist with the New York Philharmonic-Symphony Orchestra in February, a Town Hall recital, appearances with orchestras in other parts of the country and his expenses to and from Brazil.
docs.abstract: A Estrella wins Brazilian pianists award

headline.main: PIANISTS' AWARD WON BY ARNALDO ESTRELLA; Rio de Janeiro Artist Gets the Columbia Prize for Brazilians

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 13 (AP) -- The Foreign Office announced tonight that President Juan Antonio Rios had been invited by President Roosevelt to visit the United States. Usually well-informed circles said he had decided to accept.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 13 (AP) -- The Foreign Office announced tonight that President Juan Antonio Rios had been invited by President Roosevelt to visit the United States. Usually well-informed circles said he had decided to accept.
docs.abstract: Min Barros Jarpa on carrying out of Rio de Janeiro accords without Cong ratification

headline.main: CHILEAN EXECUTIVE IS INVITED TO U.S.; Rios Is Expected to Accept Bid From President Roosevelt

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 14 -- A Free Italy movement, similar in organization and intent to General Charles de Gaulle's Fighting France, will be founded by the First Pan-American Conference of Free Italians, which was inaugurated in this capital...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 14 -- A Free Italy movement, similar in organization and intent to General Charles de Gaulle's Fighting France, will be founded by the First Pan-American Conference of Free Italians, which was inaugurated in this capital tonight and which will continue sittings until Sunday morning.
docs.abstract: Free Italy movement headed by Count Sforza plans dem govt form after war

headline.main: FREE ITALY MOVE OPENS IN URUGUAY; 1,500 Delegates Representing 10,000,000 Nationals in Latin America Attend FIGHTING LEGION PLANNED United Nations' Recognition is Sought -- Sforza Heads Group Like de Gaulle's

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Aug. 15 -- An Italian republic modeled after the American democracies was envisaged by Count Carlo Sforza, former Italian Foreign Minister and an anti-Fascist, at a conference with American newspaper men today.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Aug. 15 -- An Italian republic modeled after the American democracies was envisaged by Count Carlo Sforza, former Italian Foreign Minister and an anti-Fascist, at a conference with American newspaper men today.

headline.main: COUNT SFORZA GIVES FREE IT ALIANS' AIMS; He Envisages Republic Modeled After American Democracies

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 16 (AP) -- The Pan-American Free Italy conference today adopted a proposal by the Argentine delegation that the Free Italians (anti-Fascist Italians) of North and South America state their "absolute solidarity with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 16 (AP) -- The Pan-American Free Italy conference today adopted a proposal by the Argentine delegation that the Free Italians (anti-Fascist Italians) of North and South America state their "absolute solidarity with the people of the United States, Britain, Russia, China and other United Nations."
docs.abstract: Free Italy movement conf adopts proposal

headline.main: FREE ITALIANS LINK CAUSE WITH ALLIES; Montevideo Conference Pledges Retribution for Axis Crimes

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 (U.P.) -- Leaders of the Free Italian movement, which closed a three-day conference here last night, said today that a Free Italian Legion would be organized and trained in the United States, using arms solicited from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 (U.P.) -- Leaders of the Free Italian movement, which closed a three-day conference here last night, said today that a Free Italian Legion would be organized and trained in the United States, using arms solicited from the United States Government and bought by donations from Free Italians throughout the American countries.

headline.main: FREE ITALY LEGION WOULD TRAIN IN U.S.; Committee, Ending Sessions at Montevideo, Also Plans to Purchase Arms Here AIMS TO FIGHT 'ANYWHERE' Conference Decides to War on Axis Whether or Not Allies Recognize Group
